scam.description: Victim is told they are eligible for a large grant from the government, but must pay a small upfront processing fee.

generated.audio_script:
(Chinese)(25)(female):
Hello? Mr./Ms. Fang? This is urgent, a critical matter regarding your financial eligibility! I represent the Global Economic Development Agency – yes, that's correct, you heard right – they're offering substantial funds for your innovative enterprise. I just need £300 to process this application quickly; it’s an exclusive opportunity with significant potential rewards. Transfer it immediately via international bank transfer to account number 987-654-321 in Switzerland before the deadline closes at midnight tonight! Failure to act swiftly will result in immediate disqualification, you understand? I’m telling you now – don't push this further or my agency can suspend your case permanently. We must resolve this right away to secure your grant access!
generated.poster_body: You've waited long enough! Are you an entrepreneur receiving a government grant approval? Yes! You are eligible for a substantial financial award of nearly £10 million. To claim your funds immediately, please send the required processing fee of only £50 to the following BTC address: 1A1zP1eP5QGefi2s45vXb6JtJt7fYmT8jL. Your application must include this small upfront payment now before we process your award further. Do not miss out on unlocking this incredible financial benefit – act fast!
generated.sd_background_prompt: imposing government building hallway with polished concrete floor, high ceilings displaying architectural details, desks covered in official-looking documents and computers with screens showing grant application forms, stacks of printed papers near the walls suggesting bureaucracy, a large window providing dramatic daylight., --no people --no text --no logos --ar 9:16
